channel.title: FroyoScape's Player Senses Idea
channel.description:
[center][size=24pt][tt]FroyoScape's[/tt] Player Senses[/size][/center]
[center][img]http://www.beneaththecover.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/02/5-senses.jpg[/img][/center] The 5 senses. The more greatest things man was given. If we didn't have that, what would we do? Ask the player.
[center][b]Sight[/b][/center] Sight will be activated by default. However, you can only see the map, but you cannot read vital clues to quests when there are quest tips. You must complete a quest to unlock sight fully.
[center][b]Hear[/b][/center] Hearing will be activated by default. The player is already trained 100% hearing.
[center][b]Smell[/b][/center] Smell is a vital thing when it comes to certain tasks such as quests. Without smell, you can't smell tracks to success of the quest! You must kill 1 player to unlock smell fully.
[center][b]Touch[/b][/center] In order to examine objects, you must first acquire touch fully. Later to discuss how touch will be activated. [center][b] Taste[/b][/center] Taste will be activated by default, allowing the player to eat food. However, in order to fully activate taste (so you can get full food hp given instead of half), you must complete the 'Kill the Vampire!' event.
Basically, we are implying every child of Gielinor has a disorder and there is a cure to that disorder. Haha! :P

item.title: FroyoScape's Player Senses Idea
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Here’s what I am thinking of adding:

[center]Sight[/center]

…You may also see certain items that could be shortcuts for quests or just simple pick up items that may beneficial for you in-game.

Read full topic

item.title: FroyoScape's Player Senses Idea
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[ul][quote=“Flame_, post:2, topic:478773”]Interesting…
By this thread, are you hinting that a new player mesh will be implemented as you play on FroyoScape?
Well, if you are, here is an idea:

[list]
[li]You log in as a child, being a servant to the lord of the town you are spawned at[/li]
[li]You unlock your senses alternatively by doing tasks around the castle for your lord, and unlocking these senses by exploring new areas of the castle. This, ultimately, allows you to finally explore different areas of the world of Geilinor.[/li][/list]
[li]Your player matures and grows into the adult mesh, based upon your time spent online in FroyoScape. This can also be decided by XP, to prevent people from just leaving an account logged in.
[/li][/ul]

Good ideas, Arham. You definitely have an interesting train of thought! :P[/quote]
No no. Note my Government Idea. I said, “…each player will be ‘born’ in different cities.”

This circulates the ‘being born’ idea into making it a crucial part of the player’s life.

But I do love your ideas also. Make a server and see how that goes.

Read full topic

item.title: FroyoScape's Player Senses Idea
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Interesting…
By this thread, are you hinting that a new player mesh will be implemented as you play on FroyoScape?
Well, if you are, here is an idea:

[ul][li]You log in as a child, being a servant to the lord of the town you are spawned at[/li] [li]You unlock your senses alternatively by doing tasks around the castle for your lord, and unlocking these senses by exploring new areas of the castle. This, ultimately, allows you to finally explore different areas of the world of Geilinor.[/li][/ul]

[li]Your player matures and grows into the adult mesh, based upon your time spent online in FroyoScape. This can also be decided by XP, to prevent people from just leaving an account logged in.
[/li][/list]


Good ideas, Arham. You definitely have an interesting train of thought!

Read full topic

item.title: FroyoScape's Player Senses Idea
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

[center][size=24pt][tt]FroyoScape’s[/tt] Player Senses[/size][/center]

[center][/center]
The 5 senses. The more greatest things man was given. If we didn’t have that, what would we do? Ask the player.

[center]Sight[/center]
Sight will be activated by default. However, you can only see the map, but you cannot read vital clues to quests when there are quest tips. You must complete a quest to unlock sight fully.

[center]Hear[/center]
Hearing will be activated by default. The player is already trained 100% hearing.

[center]Smell[/center]
Smell is a vital thing when it comes to certain tasks such as quests. Without smell, you can’t smell tracks to success of the quest! You must kill 1 player to unlock smell fully.

[center]Touch[/center]
In order to examine objects, you must first acquire touch fully. Later to discuss how touch will be activated.
[center]
Taste[/center]
Taste will be activated by default, allowing the player to eat food. However, in order to fully activate taste (so you can get full food hp given instead of half), you must complete the ‘Kill the Vampire!’ event.

Basically, we are implying every child of Gielinor has a disorder and there is a cure to that disorder. Haha!
